Section 01 [321001000] Hello? Is anybody there? [321001010] Someone who might be interested in rescuing the great Kenneth Haight? [321001020] Servant to the true Order, and celebrated repudiator of the false! [321001030] O Erdtree! Grant me succour! Section 03 [321003000] What are you waiting for? A kiss goodbye? [321003010] My fort lies to the south, beyond the Mistwood. Take it back for me. [321003020] Oh I see. You wish to know the reward? [321003030] Fret not, the great Kenneth Haight is known for his considerable largesse. [321003040] The celebrations will be lavish indeed, upon the dawn of my fort's retrieval. Section 04 [321004000] Hmph, yes, now allow me to furnish you with a little advice. [321004010] I would take great care to avoid Godrick's Tarnished hunts, were I in your shoes. [321004020] That depraved lot are obsessed with sacrificing Tarnished like you for the sake of "grafting". [321004030] Honestly, Godrick's nothing more than a jumped up country bumpkin. Lord? Don't make me laugh. [321004040] First he hid himself amongst the womenfolk to flee the capital, then hid from Radahn in that castle... [321004050] Then he insulted Malenia, lost to her in battle, only to lick her boots rather than die like a man. [321004060] Has he no shame, the big girl's blouse? [321004070] And to think, he's the blood of Godfrey! Last of the golden lineage, though you almost wouldn't know it to look at him. [321004080] I almost feel sorry for the chap the more I think of it. Section 05 [321005000] What are you waiting for? A kiss goodbye? [321005010] My fort lies to the south, beyond the Mistwood. Take it back for me. Section 10 [321010000] Ah, you've come to lend me your aid, have you? [321010010] Well, that's very kind, but, um... [321010020] No, no. Th-the help is very much appreciated. Even from a Tarnished. [321010030] Despite appearances, nobility is no prerequisite to serving the true Order. [321010040] You might have heard of me. Kenneth Haight. Next in line as the rightful ruler of Limgrave. [321010050] Young Tarnished, I would have a boon of you. [321010060] I want you to take back my fort. It lies to the south, beyond the Mistwood. [321010070] A Knight commander from Stormveil took it. A fool, and plumb mad to boot. Simply obsessed with blood! Section 14 [321014000] Hm? What's this, kind sir? [321014001] Hm? What's this, fair lady? [321014010] Remarkable! The Knight Commander, dead. Already! [321014020] A blessing, if ever I chanced upon one. [321014030] Fine work, I say, fine work, indeed. [321014040] I doubt that it was your intention, but the deed is done, and I commend you. [321014050] Now, this is your reward. [321014060] Go on, it is yours, for the keeping. Section 20 [321020000] Ah-ha! I've been waiting for you with baited breath! [321020010] Did you manage to recapture my fort? [321020020] Oh excellent news, just wonderful. And the knight's dead to boot! [321020030] Well done my friend, well done indeed! [321020040] I knew I was right to trust you! [321020050] Now, here's your reward, as promised. [321020060] Go ahead, it's all yours. Section 21 [321021000] Right then. Time for me to head to the fort. [321021010] I've much to do. First I'll have to reestablish communication with the demi-humans. [321021020] What's that look? You don't believe me? [321021030] Well, under the Erdtree, commingling with the demi-humans is made possible. [321021040] Even the vulgar shall not be left behind, under the rule of true Order. [321021050] Which is why I, Kenneth Haight, next in line as the rightful ruler of Limgrave, have sworn to uphold it. [321021060] Just you watch, my friend. Just you watch. Section 22 [321022000] Ah, yes. I've been meaning to ask. [321022010] Would you like to enter my service? [321022020] I see bright things in your future, stout warrior. [321022030] Enter into my service and learn the workings of the Erdtree's true Order. [321022040] And who knows, perhaps some time down the line, the grace of gold will return to those Tarnished eyes of yours. [321022050] What say you? A fine accord, is it not? Section 23 [321023000] Very well. Very well, indeed. [321023010] I knew I saw something in you. [321023020] I shall await you at my fort. [321023030] We shall hold the ceremony for your knighting there, I think. [321023040] I see great things ahead of us. We are truly by the Erdtree blessed. Section 24 [321024000] Excuse me? [321024010] Such foolishness have I never seen! [321024020] Well...not that I can't sympathise with your choice. [321024030] Such a miraculous manifestation of felicity is like to startle one such as yourself. [321024040] Should you change your mind, do visit me at my fort. Section 25 [321025000] What is it? [321026010] Such a miraculous manifestation of felicity is like to startle one such as yourself. [321026020] Oh don't fret, there's no hurry. [321026030] Should you change your mind, do visit me at my fort. Section 40 [321040000] Why... [321040010] Why the queen... Now all hope is... [321040020] (dies) Section 50 [321050000] Ah, you, is it? [321050010] I suppose you must have seen it by now, yes, the sorry state of my fort? Section 56 [323056000] ... Section 60 [323060000] ...

Section 01 [324001000] Oh, this is a rare occasion. [324001010] I can't remember the last time a new Tarnished made their way to the Roundtable. [324001020] Very well. As your senior, I bid you welcome. [324001030] It is safe here. You may let down your guard. Section 02 [324002000] Allow me a word of advice, as your senior. [324002010] You are a mere visitor to the Roundtable, nothing more. [324002020] A house guest, yet to earn their keep. [324002030] Remember your place, newcomer. Section 03 [324003000] There's nothing left to say. Be at your leisure. Section 10 [324010000] What do you need? I have little time to spare. Section 11 [324011000] Oh, are you aggrieved? At the notion you are but a visitant here? [324011010] Then you would do well to remember the first words of grace given to you. [324011020] Stand before the Elden Ring, and become the Elden Lord. [324011030] If those words held any meaning to you... [324011040] Follow the guidance of grace, lay low the shardbearers, and claim for yourself a Great Rune. [324011050] Do so, and the doors to the Roundtable's inner chamber will open. [324011060] And you will receive the wisdom of the Two Fingers. Section 12 [324012000] Once the wisdom of the Two Fingers becomes your own, I'll impart to you a proper welcome. [324012010] As a true member of the Roundtable. [324012020] I have high hopes for you. [324012030] I'm sick and tired of them. [324012040] These namby-pamby Tarnished think us no more than a shelter from the rain... Section 13 [324013000] We've spoken long enough. I have matters to attend to. Section 15 [324015000] If you haven't anything to say, I would prefer you didn't pester me for attention. [324015010] Try not to make a spectacle of yourself either. Or are you as irredeemably foolish as you appear? Section 20 [324020000] You've received the wisdom of the Two Fingers, have you not? [324020010] Then just as promised, I bid you welcome, as a true member of the Roundtable. [324020020] I am known as Gideon Ofnir. [324020030] As a Tarnished who wishes to stand before the Elden Ring and become Elden Lord, [324020040] I am accumulating knowledge. To be all-knowing. [324020050] You now belong to a select group of fellows. As such, I ask that you remain constant. Section 21 [324021000] You'll be after more Great Runes, now eh? [324021010] Then as your fellow, allow me to divulge a little knowledge. [324021020] The inheritors of the Great Runes; the shardbearers. [324021030] We of the Roundtable know the location of five of them, including the one you defeated. [324021040] Godrick the Grafted, Lord of Stormveil. [324021050] General Radahn, who fought Malenia and her rot to a standstill in the Caelid Wilds. [324021060] Praetor Rykard, Lord of the Volcano Manor of Mt. Gelmir. [324021070] Morgott the Grace-Given, Veiled Monarch and Lord of Leyndell. [324021080] And Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, ruler of Raya Lucaria's Academy. [324021090] ...You'll still be after more Great Runes, won't you? Section 22 [324022000] So. Godrick the Grafted, Lord of Stormveil. [324022010] Despite being the blood of Godfrey, first Elden Lord, he's a grotesque old fool, grasping for power. [324022020] His castle lies upon the cliff to Limgrave's northwest. [324022030] ...but I suspect you know that well enough already. Section 23 [324023000] General Radahn, the famed Red Lion and scourge of the stars, is a ferocious warrior. [324023010] He fought Malenia and her rot to a standstill in the Caelid Wilds to Limgrave's east. [324023020] And now Caelid has been engulfed by the scarlet rot, even approaching the region is no mean feat. [324023030] I've heard survivors of Radahn's army are still in the wilds, staving off the rot with fire. [324023040] And if it's true, I suspect Radahn is still there as well, in Caelid. [324023050] Though I doubt he much resembles his former self anymore... Section 24 [324024000] Praetor Rykard is the Lord of the Volcano Manor on Mt. Gelmir. [324024010] He is a ruthless justiciar who commands a company of inquisitors, reviled for his serpentine demeanour. [324024020] The volcano, Mt. Gelmir, lies in the west of the Altus Plateau; the realm of the Erdtree. [324024030] It was the stage of the most appalling battle in the entirety of the Shattering. [324024040] Rykard has committed the grave sin of blasphemy. Marking himself as an enemy, never to be forgiven. Section 25 [324025000] Morgott the Grace-Given is Lord of Leyndell, the capital city. [324025010] It lies at the foot of the Erdtree, in the east of the Altus Plateau. [324025020] But the Two Fingers forbid us from venturing there. [324025030] Until we've acquired enough Great Runes to repair the Elden Ring. [324025040] Set your sights elsewhere for the time being. The Veiled Monarch can wait. Section 26 [324026000] The Academy of Raya Lucaria lies to Limgrave's north, towering over the mist-laden lands of Liurnia. [324026010] Rennala is the queen of the Carian royals, who govern the academy. [324026020] But Rennala herself is no demigod. [324026030] She is merely the recipient of an amber egg, given to her by Radagon, [324026040] Her beloved, Radagon, left her to become Queen Marika's second husband, taking the title of King Consort. [324026050] The Great Rune dwells within the amber egg that was Radagon's gift to her. Section 27 [324027000] There are four more demigods yet to be located. [324027010] Miquella of the Haligtree, the Unalloyed. [324027020] His twin, Malenia, the undefeated swordswoman. [324027030] Lunar Princess Ranni, daughter to Rennala. [324027040] And the one only known as the Lord of Blood. [324027050] Ranni is said to have cast aside her Great Rune, [324027060] so here at the Hold, we seek the whereabouts of the remaining three shardbearers. [324027070] If you should learn anything of these matters, [324027080] I'll trade your findings for a hidden treasure, or a long-lost rite, known only to me. [324027090] We both desire to stand before the Elden Ring, and become Elden Lord. [324027100] As such, I hope we are compelled to work together. [324027580] I'll trade your findings for something rather special. Section 30 [324030000] Ah, you. What is it? Section 31 [324031000] Well...what is it now? Section 32 [324032000] Well. I see you've found another Great Rune. [324032010] Wonderful. You are a worthy fellow Tarnished, indeed. [324032020] Make the journey. [324032030] To the capital Leyndell, that lies to the east of the Altus Plateau, at the foot of the Erdtree. [324032040] The Two Fingers will deny your passage no longer. [324032050] You may be our best hope. Find your way to the Elden Ring. [324032060] For we are Tarnished. And we must answer the call of grace. [324041040] A determined plebian is more wicked than an Omen horn, quite frankly. [324041050] I suspect...that's just what the Queen wants. [324041060] A dose of ambition, to incite the Tarnished. [324042030] The Roundtable has no code to speak of. [324042040] But, I ask you this. Are you really going to do the bidding of that twisted dolly botherer? [324042050] Or would you rather hand that potion to me, and see if we can't get one over on the bastard? Section 43 [324043000] Good. I'll dispose of the potion myself. [324043010] You go and see Seluvis, but don't give anything away. [324043020] Just tell him that you tricked your mark into drinking the potion as planned. [324043030] Despite knowing next to bloody nothing, he's so far up his own arse he won't suspect a thing. [324043040] His inevitable display of arrogance will certainly be a sight to behold. Section 44 [324044000] Well, I won't force you. [324044010] But I think your plan would be a dreadful waste. [324044020] She's not herself right now, and though I have no need of her, she still has potential. [324044030] Certainly more value than she'd have as a bloody puppet. Section 45 [324045000] I hear you helped get the girl back on her feet. [324045010] Though I'm not her foster father anymore, I'd still like to thank you. [324045020] Sorry. For the time you had to waste. Section 46 [324046000] Well, I won't force you. [324046010] If you want to do that dolly botherer's bidding, that's up to you. [324046020] Not that I could fathom why you'd want to... Section 50 [324050000] Oh, my apologies for that nasty business. [324050010] Ensha got rather ahead of himself, it seems. [324050020] As his master, I'd like to express my regret. [324050030] But now, Ensha is slain and gone. [324050040] Finished, forever more. [324051050] together with her great wolf. Section 52 [324052000] Find the Albinauric woman. Section 60 [324060000] Ahh, I know already. You're after it too, aren't you. [324060010] To pass the impenetrable thorns, you seek the forge of the flame of ruin, in the snowy mountaintops of the giants. [324060020] Then you need to reach the Grand Lift of Rold, beyond the forbidden region. [324060030] Hah, no need to pay me for that gift. [324060040] All my knowledge is for the sake of guidance. [324060050] That a Tarnished might stand before the Elden Ring, and become Elden Lord. [324060060] It doesn't have to be me, my fellow. Section 61 [324061000] If you're heading to the forge of the flame of ruin, in the snowy mountaintops of the giants. [324061010] You'll need to find the Grand Lift of Rold, beyond the forbidden region. [324061020] I marked your map with its location. [324061030] Go, if you would. Take no heed of "cardinal sin". [324061040] The Two Fingers lost their purpose a long, long time ago. Section 70 [324070000] Ahh, I see you've laid your hands on the other secret medallion. [324070010] I'm glad to see my counsel has borne fruit, but the honour of the deed is yours alone. [324070020] You've made more of yourself than Ensha has... [324070030] Now, more importantly, both secret medallions are in your hands. [324070040] I suppose you'd like to know then? What awaits you on the path ahead? [324070050] Me too, my friend, me too. I wait with baited breath. Section 71 [324071000] Ahh, so the secret medallions led you to the land of the Haligtree? [324071010] I'd expect to find Malenia there. She who fought Radahn to a standstill. [324071020] Well, if the scarlet rot hasn't eaten her away completely. [324071030] But...with the Haligtree as it is... [324071040] I suppose Miquella must already be... Section 72 [324072000] Ah, my apologies. Lost myself, for a moment there. [324072010] The information you've shared is of great value. As promised, your reward: [324072020] A hidden treasure, known only to me. [324072030] A secret rite known only to me. [324072040] You are a true fellow. All I ask is that you remain constant. [324072530] And it is a wondrous thing indeed. Section 73 [324073000] So. The Haligtree, now but a husk... [324073010] I heard speculation Miquella embedded himself in the Haligtree, [324073020] but before he could finish, someone cut the tree open and absconded with his infant form. [324073030] Indeed, it seems those words held weight. [324073040] How vexing. That the All-knowing didn't have the full story... [324073050] Perhaps the Queen's sorrow was justified... Section 74 [324074000] Oh, so that's where the so-called Lord of Blood was hiding himself eh. [324074010] A fitting little squat for that deluded maniac to bleat about the revival of his precious dynasty, while he turns our fellow Tarnished into Bloody Fingers. [324074020] Let him stay there. That way, his delusions will remain as they are - distant and unattainable. [324074030] But perhaps it's worth looking into... [324074040] If what I've heard is right, then maybe... Section 75 [324075000] Ahh, I see! So Miquella was with the Lord of Blood after all! [324075010] That is some fine intelligence indeed! [324075020] With it, the final clue has been brought into the light. [324075030] One of the last few pieces the Roundtable-- I need, to put everything together. [324075040] As promised, allow me to impart to you [324075050] the last of the hidden treasures known only to me. [324075060] the last of the secret rites known only to me. [324075070] a thing most wondrous, known only to me. Section 76 [324076000] Well, I wonder what comes next... [324076010] If he continues his slumber within the cocoon, all would be well. [324076020] But perhaps it would be safer to destroy it. [324076030] Miquella is the one thing that remains a mystery to me... Section 77 [324077000] You...burned the Erdtree, didn't you? [324077010] Then the Roundtable is soon to follow. [324077020] Ah, no need to fret about that. [324077030] The Roundtable Hold served to put a Tarnished upon the throne of Elden Lord. [324077040] And if the Erdtree needed to burn for that to happen, [324077050] then the Roundtable must go, as well. Section 78 [324078000] I'll stay at the Roundtable, for a time. [324078010] I must learn all that can be taken from this place, [324078020] and sear it into my memory. [324078030] How could I call myself the All-Knowing, if I did any less? Section 79 [324079000] The pursuit of knowledge is without end, for knowledge is never a thing complete. [324079010] Thus, I maintain the mantle of All-Knowing. [324079020] Perhaps the same could be said of guidance. [324079030] Who's to say whether we'll remain who we are, once the fight is finished? [324079040] What do you think, as one who aspires to become Elden Lord? Section 80 [324080000] Ahh, I knew you'd come. [324080010] To stand before the Elden Ring. To become Elden Lord. [324080020] What a sad state of affairs. [324080030] I commend your spirit, but alas, none shall take the throne. [324080040] Queen Marika has high hopes for us. [324080050] That we continue to struggle. Unto eternity.
Section 00 [324100000] You think I don't know what that is? [324100010] I have no secrets for you to salaciously gawp at. [324100020] You think too little of Gideon Ofnir, the All-knowing.

Section 00 [324800000] My fellow, you've fought well, until now. Section 01 [324801000] I know...in my bones... [324801010] A Tarnished cannot become a Lord. Not even you. [324801020] A man cannot kill a god...

Section 01 [325001000] Ah, nice to meet you. [325001010] The pleasure's mine. Rogier's the name. A sorcerer, as you might have guessed. [325001020] I'm looking for a little something, here in the castle. [325001030] When I'm not hotfooting it from the troops, that is. [325001040] But enough about me, what are you doing here in Stormveil Castle? [325001050] This place is bristling with Tarnished hunters, you know. They sacrifice our kind, for grafting. [325001060] Not exactly a place I'd stroll into without a purpose in mind... Section 02 [325002000] I see. Here to challenge Godrick, and lay your hands upon a Great Rune, are you? [325002010] You can see it then, I take it? The guidance of grace. [325002020] Well, enjoy it while you can. [325002030] I'm Tarnished, like you. [325002040] But unlike you, I've seen neither hide nor hair of this guidance for the longest time. [325002050] Still, I won't forget how it felt when I first came here, to the Lands Between. [325002060] I'm privy to a few magical battle arts. [325002070] Would you care to learn one? [325002080] As a fellow Tarnished, once guided by grace. I'd love to help you out, if it please. Section 03 [325003000] Oh? Keen to learn another battle art, are we? Section 04 [325004000] Oh hello there, good to see you safe. [325004010] Stopping by to learn a battle art or two? Section 05 [325005000] The battle art you've learned is of the glintstone family. [325005010] They were conceived at the great Academy of Raya Lucaria, to the north of this castle. [325005020] In the past, they obeyed laws which contravened the Golden Order, or so I'm told. [325005030] Fascinating, isn't it? [325005040] That the Golden Order was pliable enough to absorb practices that contradicted itself in the past. [325005050] With the Order broken, twisted, and in need of repair, [325005060] such adaptability is more important now than ever. Section 06 [325006000] Of course. I understand. [325006010] Why place trust in a perfect stranger? [325006020] Be safe, then, stranger. [325006030] Watch you don't get sacrificed, eh. I'll do the same. Section 07 [325007000] Oh? Something bothering you? [325007010] Or are you just trying to pass the time? [325007020] I'm curious how you ended up inside this castle. Section 20 [325020000] Ah, we meet again after all. [325020010] I apologise for any offence given by my bearing, but I'm quite unable to move, you see. [325020020] So. What do you need? Section 21 [325021000] Ah, you defeated Godrick and claimed yourself a Great Rune. [325021010] Mm, looks like we both got we wanted out of Stormveil, didn't we. [325021020] Well done, friend. [325021030] Something to mark the occasion. Go on, take it. [325021040] As you might've guessed, I still can't move. My fighting days are behind me. [325021050] No need to be polite, I've no use for it anymore. Section 22 [325022000] The misshapen corpse under Stormveil? [325022010] That is a sacred relic. Of the black knives plot. As that famed night of assassination is known. [325022020] It happened during the Golden Age of the Erdtree, long before the shattering of the Elden Ring. [325022030] Someone stole a fragment of the Rune of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade. [325022040] And on a bitter night, murdered Godwyn the Golden. [325022050] That was the first recorded Death of a demigod in all history. [325022060] And it became the catalyst. Soon, the Elden Ring was smashed, and thus sprang forth the war known as the Shattering. [325022070] I once wished to become a scholar, you see. I've spent many an hour scouring the archives for knowledge of that fateful plot. [325022080] The world has grown crooked, and if you intend to put it to rights, [325022090] You'd better understand what happened to make it this way, mm? Section 23 [325023000] This...is a black knifeprint! [325023010] I can scarcely believe you managed to get your hands on this! [325023020] You recall our conversation about the Night of the Black Knives, yes? [325023030] They say the assassins who carried out the deed were scions of the Eternal City. [325023040] A group entirely of women, arrayed in armour of silver under cloaks which fooled the eye. [325023050] The knives they wielded though, were imparted with the power of the Rune of Death through sinister rite. [325023060] Please, I beg of you, lend me the knifeprint for a time. [325023070] I'd love nothing more than to tease out its secrets. [325023080] Though only a fragment, a very specific ritual had to be performed to impart the power of the Rune of Death. [325023090] Traces of the one who performed the rite are sure to remain in the imprint... [325023100] Half my body has been suffused with Death. I'm certain it will help me see. Section 24 [325024000] Oh, still need something? Section 26 [325026000] Always good to see you safe. [325026010] So. What do you need? Section 27 [325027000] Ah, so you've met D. [325027010] D is an old friend. [325027020] We found ourselves journeying together for a time, bound by our exploration of Death. [325027030] But our paths have since diverged. Never again to cross. [325027040] Though that's hardly an uncommon fate for two friends. Section 28 [325028000] Pleased to meet you. [325028010] The name's Rogier. A sorcerer, by trade. [325028020] But now I'm in this sorry state. [325028030] I had a little mishap, and now I can't move. [325028040] As you might guess, it's far from ideal... Section 29 [325029000] Ah, I know. [325029010] I'm privy to a few magical battle arts. [325029020] Would you care to learn one? [325029030] Time can move rather slowly, stuck here, you know. [325029040] A little conversation goes a long way. Section 30 [325030000] Ahh, hello. I was hoping to see you. [325030010] My examination is complete. Here's the knifeprint back, with my thanks. [325030020] Now, I have a fairly good idea who performed the rite upon the blade. The person who orchestrated the Night of the Black Knives. [325030030] Lunar Princess Ranni. One of the children born to King Consort Radagon and his first wife, Renalla. [325030040] Demigod and sister to General Radahn and Praetor Rykard. [325030050] Her's was the name I discovered in the imprint. [325030060] Truly, you have my thanks. [325030070] But, if I might be so bold, I would also like to ask something more of you. [325030080] If Ranni truly is the one who plotted that fateful night, [325030090] then she should bear the cursemark of Destined Death somewhere upon her flesh. [325030100] I would like you to procure it for me. [325030110] And then all will be laid bare. I will have the answers I have sought for so long. [325030120] Don't fret, it is entirely in accordance with the guidance of grace. [325030130] If you seek to stand before the Elden Ring and become Elden Lord, [325030140] The answers you find will surely bolster your chances. Section 31 [325031000] I have some idea of Ranni's potential whereabouts. [325031010] There's a manor to the north of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. [325031020] It is the familial home of the Carian royals from whom Ranni descends. [325031030] There's been talk of the old royals' vassals gathering there in recent years [325031040] Ranni's whereabouts since the Shattering are a well-kept secret. She hasn't been seen even once. [325031050] But I suspect she might have returned to the manor in which she was born... Section 32 [325032000] If Lunar Princess Ranni truly is the one who plotted that fateful night, [325032010] then she should bear the cursemark of Destined Death somewhere upon her flesh. [325032020] Would you be willing to procure it for me? [325032030] She may have returned to the manor that is her home. [325032040] The Royal Carian residence to the north of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Section 33 [325033000] I'm afraid there's something I must tell you. [325033010] Do you know of Those Who Live in Death? [325033020] The very notion of life in death defies the Golden Order. [325033030] By D's account, these defiled fiends must be expunged. [325033040] But truth be told, I seek the cursemark to save them. [325033050] You may find this peculiar, [325033060] but I discovered something in my examination of the Night of the Black Knives. [325033070] These souls have committed no offence. They have every right to life, only, they happened to touch upon a flaw in the Order. Section 34 [325034000] Yes, indeed. [325034010] If D knew what drives me now, [325034020] he would surely boil over with rage. [325034030] Or perhaps, he would even feel some pity. Section 01 [326001000] Not seen you before. [326001010] Name's Bernahl. Tarnished, just like you. [326001020] Let me ask you something. [326001030] Are you here in the Lands Between to take up the fight? [326001040] Does your faith in the guidance of grace hold firm, [326001050] despite the collapse of the Golden Order? Section 02 [326002000] Yes, you're a Tarnished through and through. [326002010] Takes me back, but that's a quality needed now more than ever. [326002020] Any interest in bearing the torch, of my battle arts? [326002030] All I know is the sword. Picked up a fair few tricks in my time, too. [326002040] Now's the time to pass 'em on. To a good and proper Tarnished, like you. Section 03 [326003000] Oh, not had your fill, eh? Worry not, I've enough to keep you busy. Section 04 [326004000] Ah, hello. Glad to see you safe. [326004010] Here to learn a battle art or two? Section 05 [326005000] There's a myriad of battle arts in these lands that I've yet to discover. [326005010] Mementos of all the warriors who raised their arms in battle, lost, and died. [326005020] A fine tale, all told, of true chivalric romance. [326005030] That's how I fell in love with the sword, and the arts of combat. [326005040] It grants meaning even to falling in battle, to death itself. Section 06 [326006000] Honest to a fault, I see. [326006010] Such thoughts won't behove you, as a Tarnished. [326006020] But there's nothing wrong with that. [326006030] Any interest in bearing the torch, of my battle arts? [326006040] All I know is the sword. Picked up a fair few tricks in my time, too. [326006050] Now's the time to pass 'em on. To a good Tarnished, like you. Section 07 [326007000] Not floating your boat, eh? [326007010] Well, there's no rush. Knowledge of the arts can wait another day. Section 08 [326008000] There you are. Decided to bear the torch of my battle arts? Section 09 [326009000] Well, until we meet again. Section 10 [326010000] You... [326010010] What in heaven's name are you doing here? [326010020] The Volcano Manor is a pit of recusants who spit at grace and hunt our own kind. [326010030] I hope you understand the weight of my words. Section 11 [326011000] Well. As long as you understand what you're saying. [326011010] I thought you a Tarnished bred by virtue. [326011020] Perhaps playing that part led you to your doubts, I wonder. [326011030] But know that the path you walk is blasphemy, and leads only to a miserable death. [326011040] Before you consider hunting any of your own kind, think on that. Section 12 [326012000] This blasphemous path leads only to a pitiful death. [326012010] Before you consider hunting any of your own kind, think on that. Section 13 [326013000] So. You've bloodied your sword in the hunt. [326013010] Then I shall introduce myself once more. [326013020] Bernahl, a recusant, just like you. [326013030] Recusants have particular battle arts, styled to our methods of slaughter. [326013040] Why not add some to your repertoire? Section 14 [326014000] Oh, not had your fill, eh? Section 15 [326015000] You're still alive, I see. [326015010] Why not learn another battle art, see if we can't keep it that way. Section 16 [326016000] You've come to understand, now, eh? [326016010] To take power and make it his own, [326016020] The recusant must hunt his own kind. [326016030] To raise the flag of revolt against this sanctified pillaging, [326016040] We recusants must become the most wretched of predators. [326016050] All you can do is laugh. Section 17 [326017000] Look at you. A recusant through and through. [326017010] I knew you had it in you. [326017020] Take this. [326017030] A special invitation, to hunt some of the first Tarnished who sat at the Roundtable Hold. [326017040] If you should accept, I'll next see you on the field of battle. Section 18 [326018000] Ah, I had hoped you'd soon return. [326018010] I have the reward from Lady Tanith. [326018020] Take it. It's yours, by right. [326018030] Let us tread the path of the recusant together. [326018040] Till we reach the miserable death that awaits us. Section 20 [326020000] So. You killed Rykard? [326020010] I harbour you no ill will. The strong take. Such is our code. [326020020] Even he was prepared to meet a wretched end when he first took blasphemy unto his very flesh. [326020030] But anyroad, the Volcano Manor is no more. [326020040] Though we may yet fulfil an old promise. [326020050] We hunted our own kind, and took what was theirs. [326020060] And with everything in hand, the time has come to rise, against the Erdtree. Section 21 [326021000] O Greater Will, hear my voice. [326021010] I am the recusant Bernahl, inheritor of my brother's will, and you will fall to my blade. [326021020] We refuse to become your pawns. Consider this fair warning. Section 30 [326030000] Who are you? [326030010] And what in heaven's name are you doing here? [326030020] The Volcano Manor is a pit of recusants who spit at grace and hunt our own kind. [326030030] I hope you understand the weight of my words. Section 40 [326040000] Well. As long as you understand what you're saying. [326040010] You have harboured doubts from the very beginning. [326040020] Perhaps this day was always lurking on the horizon. [326040030] But know that the path you walk is blasphemy, and leads only to a miserable death. [326040040] Before you consider hunting any of your own kind, think on that. Section 41 [326041000] Then you must leave immediately. [326041010] Those with weak stomachs have no place here. Section 42 [326042000] I thought I told you to leave. [326042010] Or do you claim to understand? [326042020] What it means to be a recusant, renouncing grace and hunting down one's own. Section 43 [326043000] Well. As long as you understand what you're saying. [326043010] But know that the path you walk is blasphemy, and leads only to a miserable death. [326043020] Before you consider hunting any of your own kind, think on that.

Section 00 [326800000] Agh! [326800010] What's wrong with you? [326800020] I won't say it twice. Stop this. Section 01 [326801000] I suppose I have no choice, then. [326801010] Is this what grace would have of us? Section 02 [326802000] Dog eat dog, once again. A sad lot, we Tarnished. Section 03 [326803000] You are an enigma, to be certain. [326803010] The Volcano Manor awaits you.

Section 01 [330001000] You're Tarnished, aren't you? [330001010] I welcome you, to the Church of Vows. [330001020] I am Miriel, steward of this sacred chamber. [330001030] My apologies, for the unseemly state of affairs. [330001040] Do you know the origin of this place? [330001050] How it came to be known as the Church of Vows? Section 02 [330002000] Well, that is a shame. But who can blame you? [330002010] The Shattering has caused us - all of us - to lose sight of something very dear. [330002020] It is here, at the Church of Vows, that the great houses of the Erdtree and the Moon were joined. [330002030] By the matrimonial bond between red-haired Radagon and Rennala of the Full Moon. [330002040] And so, our church holds in view the monuments of both houses. [330002050] The Erdtree of the Capital, and the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Section 03 [330003000] Oh, was there something you needed? [330003010] You are free to show yourself around. [330003020] I would serve as your guide, only my legs aren't what they used to be... [330003030] If you find anything of use, you are free to take it with you. [330003040] Unless perhaps you are in search of instruction? [330003050] In which case, I will share all that I know. [330003060] Whether it be sorcery or incantations, learning should not fetter you to one side or the other. [330003070] This is, after all, a church celebrating the union of two such opposed practitioners. Section 04 [330004000] Is there something else? Section 10 [330010000] Greetings. Do you need anything? Section 11 [330011000] Do you possess any celestial dew? [330011010] Then I would like to share my knowledge with you. [330011020] Concerning the miracle of this Church of Vows. [330011030] Radagon once cleansed himself with celestial dew, [330011040] repented his territorial aggressions, and swore his love to Rennala. [330011050] The Order of the Erdtree and the fate of the moon were conjoined, and all the wounds of war forgiven. [330011060] This miracle blesses the church to this day. [330011070] And so, you need only follow Radagon's example, [330011080] to restore any bond, however strained or severed, to its rightful state of harmony. Section 12 [330012000] My faith does not waver. [330012010] The miracle rooted in these grounds will, once again, mend the world. [330012020] And this time, its bounty will not be squandered. [330012030] If you would be Elden Lord, Tarnished, [330012040] I hope that you, too, will share my faith. Section 14 [330014000] Are you taking the sword with you? [330014010] Oh, fear not, I don't wish to chide you. [330014020] Clearly, you are no conniving thief. [330014030] The sword is telling us something, no doubt. [330014040] Rather than collect dust in the shadows underground, [330014050] it yearns to be wielded by your rightful hand. [330014060] Ah, now I recall. [330014070] As the priest of the Church of Vows, I undo the sword's seal, and bequeath it unto you. [330014080] May you hold it high and proud. Section 20 [330020000] Are you quite finished? [330020010] Take this opportunity to learn to master your emotions. [330020020] Worry not, I take no offence. But others are not always so forgiving. [330020030] Some take to anger, others sorrow... Bonds are fragile things, wont to break under strain. [330020040] And once they're broken, everything is lost, with naught to gain. Section 21 [330021000] Are you quite finished? [330021010] I suppose my ample frame must have given you quite the fright. [330021020] Allow me to introduce myself. Miriel, steward of this sacred chamber. [330021030] My apologies, for the unseemly state of affairs. [330021040] Do you know the origin of this place? [330021050] How it came to be known as the Church of Vows? Section 22 [330022000] Are you quite finished, now? Section 31 [330031000] To experience the miracle, kneel in the basin at the back, and cleanse yourself with celestial dew. [330031010] Absolution will be yours. Any bond, no matter how strained, or even severed, will be put to rights. Section 33 [330033000] Ah, I see you have undergone absolution, the miracle that blossoms from these grounds. [330033010] Good. As such, the bond you may have strained or severed... [330033020] Has been restored, to its rightful state of harmony. [330033030] Be mindful, not to take for granted... [330033040] the serenity restored by this miracle. [330033050] And take care. Never to break a bond again. Section 50 [330050000] You wish to know more of Lord Radagon? [330050010] Lord Radagon was a great champion, possessed of flowing red locks. [330050020] He came to these lands at the head of a great golden host, when he met Lady Rennala in battle. [330050030] He soon repented his territorial aggressions though, and became husband to the Carian Queen. [330050040] However. When Godfrey, first Elden Lord, was hounded from the Lands Between, [330050050] Radagon left Rennala to return to the Erdtree Capital, becoming Queen Marika's second husband and King Consort. [330050060] Taking the title...of second Elden Lord. [330050070] The mystery endures, to this day... [330050080] As to why Lord Radagon would cast Lady Rennala aside... [330050090] And moreover...why a mere champion would be chosen for the seat of Elden Lord... Section 51 [330051000] You know, it's said that Lord Radagon harboured a secret... [330051010] A famed sculptor of the Erdtree Capital was once summoned to render Lord Radagon's likeness in giant stature. [330051020] When he glimpsed the skeleton in Radagon's closet. [330051030] And as such, it's said the great statue harbours his secret too. Section 52 [330052000] You wish to know more of Lady Rennala? [330052010] She is Queen, head of the Carian royal family, and governor of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. [330052020] The great and beautiful Full Moon Witch. [330052030] Sadly, her heart was broken when Lord Radagon left her. [330052040] And then, when the academy rebelled against the royals, she was locked away in the grand library. Section 53 [330053000] In the end, Lady Rennala was left alone, cradling the amber egg Lord Radagon bequeathed her. [330053010] Now she devotes herself to it through forbidden rite; [330053020] the grim art of reincarnation. [330053030] You would do well to remember... [330053040] Severing a vow, strongest of bonds, has consequences ever more dire. Section 60 [330060000] Why, this is nectar, is it not? [330060010] And you're giving it to me? [330060020] Oh, wonderful, just wonderful. [330060030] Truth be told, I'm rather fond of the stuff. [330060040] I'll happily take it off your hands! Section 61 [330061000] sleeping

Section 01 [333001000] You're Tarnished, aren't you? [333001010] Then, perhaps you could spare some runes? [333001020] Believe it or not, I studied glintstone sorceries at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. [333001030] For a small donation, I'd be happy to share my knowledge. Section 02 [333002000] Well, bless you, bless you. [333002010] You are a true saint. [333002020] My name is Thops. [333002030] Presuming you're interested, I can teach you sorceries, as promised. [333002040] Only, none of them are particularly great... Section 03 [333003000] Back to learn another? [333003010] Wonderful. You're most welcome, to any of my anaemic little spells. Section 04 [333004000] Back to learn another? [333004010] Why, of course. Section 05 [333005000] Well, I can't blame you, I suppose. [333005010] But, in the case that you do change your mind, [333005020] just speak up, loud and clear. Section 06 [333006000] Oh, there you are. [333006010] Care to donate a few runes? [333006020] Believe it or not, I studied glintstone sorceries at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. [333006030] For a small donation, I'd be happy to share my knowledge. Section 20 [333020000] Apologies, friend. [333020010] I'm afraid my meagre sorceries are no match for your generosity. [333020020] Oh, right. [333020030] I can tell you what I know about this place. That should help a bit. [333020040] You've seen that structure to the north, towering over the water? [333020050] That's the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Where we study glintstone sorceries. [333020060] Only, its doors have been closed for quite some time now. [333020070] After they declared they wouldn't interfere with the Shattering, [333020080] the academy cast repelling seals on the east gate leading to the Capital and the south gate leading here. [333020100] As you might have guessed, the seals are still active, [333020110] making entry to the academy impossible without a glintstone key. [333020120] And so I'm stuck here. A fledgling sorcerer, with little chance of acquiring a key. [333020130] When they cast the seals, I'd just popped out, and now I'm uprooted from my place of learning. Section 21 [333021000] Why not find yourself a glintstone key? [333021010] Without one, you can't pass through the academy, [333021020] and you'll never reach the Erdtree Capital. [334020040] I need no external aid. [334020050] Not to brave the horrors of battle. Nor to bolster my resolve. Section 30 [334030000] Oh, it's you... [334030020] Well, what do you make of it? [334041020] For indulging my emotions. Forgetting the mission. Punishment for offing his pawns. [334041030] Father...rather, Lord Gideon has offered me guidance all my life. [334041040] I would have done anything for him, to place him on the throne of Elden Lord. [334041050] And yet I... Though it was not my intent... [334041060] I betrayed him... [334070040] This land is much like the one from which I hail. [334070050] I will call upon the storm, to drive away the foulness that has settled on the winds. Section 71 [334071000] Again, I am Nepheli Loux. Warrior. [334071010] Some call me by the title of Lady, but I remain the same woman underneath. [334071050] I would gladly lighten your burden. Section 72 [334072000] Farewell, fellow warrior. [334072010] I will remain, to summon the storm. [334072020] But your guidance, and your fight... Section 01 [337001000] Welcome, dear guest. [337001010] After being out there, it must be quite surprising, [337001020] to see our capital, cradled by the Erdtree, showered by an eternal wellspring of grace. [337001030] The sights, the sounds, the luscious scents. Each precisely as they should be. Each eternal. Section 02 [337002000] Oh? [337002010] I didn't notice that you were Tarnished. [337002020] ... [337002030] Now, you mustn't take this the wrong way. [337002040] But you must leave the capital at once. Section 03 [337003000] It is for your own good, I assure you. [337003010] All things have their proper place. [337003020] We, having been chosen by grace, were given this Golden Capital. [337003030] You, on the other hand, have your own home, which is a far cry from here. [337003040] So far, in fact, that it cannot be further marred by your touch. [337003050] The Shattering caused a great many fools to overstep their bounds. [337003060] Their impudence led to insurgency against Morgott, Lord of Grace. They raised an army, and sought to lay siege to this sacred ground. [337003070] But do you see where it got them? King Morgott's rule would not be shaken! [337003080] Their attempt to defile the capital failed, and while we revelled in eternal grace, [337003090] the traitors were eyed by the grotesque Fell Omen, and their corpses piled high outside the wall! [337003100] The lesson here is self-evident. [337003110] The capital is simply not where you belong. Section 04 [337004000] You mustn't take it the wrong way. [337004010] But you must leave the capital at once. Section 10 [337010000] Well, what have we here... [337010010] You hunt Omen, do you? [337010020] Mm-hmm, yes it appears so... [337010030] Well, then perhaps we can talk. [337010040] For a barbarous Tarnished, you see the difference between right and wrong rather clearly. [337010050] Very well. I permit your stay in the capital for the time being. [337010060] And in the name of the house of Shanehaight, I beseech you hunt down the foul Omen. [337010070] The Undercapital is a repository of waste. [337010080] For ages it's teemed with repulsive Omen. Fiendlings, even, who've never lost a horn. [337010090] And what's worse, they've taken to bellowing in a most blood-curdling manner. You can hear it all the way up here. [337010100] A vile, ceaseless affront to the Erdtree's sanctity. Section 11 [337011000] Get on with it, then. [337011010] Hunt down the vile Omen scurrying about in the Undercapital, and give us peace from those wretched howls. [337011020] I know you can do it. Do not dishonour House Shanehaight. Section 20 [337020000] Haven't set off to hunt the Omen yet? [337020010] Well, you're certainly dragging your heels more than I foresaw. [337020020] I forgive you. [337020030] We Shanehaights are known for patience, a virtue amongst the noble. Section 21 [337021000] Haven't set off to hunt the Omen yet? [337021010] That wretched screeching... I feel as if I could go mad. Section 30 [337030000] Ohh, there you are, pleased to see you. [337030010] You must've expunged the Omen from the repository. [337030020] Otherwise their revolting screeches would still be affronting my ears. [337030030] Well, you've done us a fine service, I must say. [337030040] The Erdbishops will be very pleased to hear it. [337030050] No, this is above their station... [337030060] If I explained that this was all my idea, [337030070] I could be granted audience with Morgott, Lord of Grace. [337030080] What a wondrous opportunity. [337030090] That a viscount as myself might be seen by the Lord of Grace. [337030100] Such an honour will place me amongst the most venerated Shanehaights. Section 31 [337031000] Oh, very sorry, I almost forgot about you completely. [337031010] This Shanehaight heirloom has been held for generations. [337031020] It is yours now, a reward for your fearless execution of my request. Section 32 [337032000] I'm afraid its worth might be lost on a Tarnished, but... [337032010] For everything, there is a first. For you, and for House Shanehaight, and its newfound glory. Section 33 [337033000] Now, I need to get myself ready. [337033010] If fortune favours me, and I am seen by the Lord of Grace, [337033020] I'd be put to shame if I didn't look my very best. Section 40 [337040000] Kill our lord... [337040010] He is a stain upon all things golden... [337040020] Kill Morgott, kingly impostor! [337040030]

Section 01 [348001000] Ah...ahh... Section 02 [348002000] Ngh... W-who's there? [348002010] Well, it matters not. If you are wise, you will leave, immediately. [348002020] My flesh writhes with scarlet rot. [348002030] It is a curse. Not to be meddled with by man. Section 03 [348003000] If you are wise, you will leave, immediately. [348003010] My flesh writhes with scarlet rot. Section 10 [348010000] You ask that I stab myself with the needle... [348010010] To quell the scarlet rot? [348010020] But...how? [348010030] ... [348010040] Never mind. I've decided. [348010050] I would rather trust you, [348010060] than simply continue to spoil from within. Section 11 [348011000] Would you mind...averting your eyes for a moment? [348011050] Well. That was easier than expected. [348011060] But...why do I feel so... [348011070] ... Section 12 [348012000] ... Section 20 [348020000] I...hoped to see you again. [348020010] My apologies, for when last we met. I fainted before I could even thank you. [348020020] Everything is as you said. Since inserting the needle, the scarlet rot has ceased to writhe. [348020030] Even the nightmares have abated... And now, though I can scarcely believe it myself, I can move as I please. [348020040] Not that I could ever truly repay you, [348020050] but I would like you to have this, by way of thanks. A token, though it is. Section 21 [348021000] I'm considering leaving. On a journey. [348021010] With the needle buried in my flesh, I've started to recall, but dimly... [348021020] My destiny... [348021030] It's all thanks to you. [348021040] My name is Millicent. I pray fate permits us meet again. Section 22 [348022000] I'm considering leaving. On a journey. [348022010] With the needle buried in my flesh, I've started to recall, but dimly... [348022020] My destiny... Section 25 [348025000] Oh, hello again. [348025010] Something about this place felt familiar to me. [348025020] So I decided to pay a visit, hoping to find someone here. [348025030] But I've only found emptiness. [348025040] Perhaps before my departure, I needed someone to say farewell to. Section 26 [348026000] Well, never mind that. [348026010] I must focus on my journey, for which I have you to thank. [348026020] I must stay strong. Section 30 [348030000] Ah. We meet again. [348030010] In truth, it's been smooth sailing, for me. [348030020] The scarlet rot has stilled, since last we met. [348030030] As such, I've been able to continue my journey. [348030040] Though rather vexingly, [348030050] I realise that if I still had my sword arm, [348030060] I could have aided you in battle. Section 31 [348031000] Now, I'm tracing the path Malenia took, [348031010] after unleashing the power of the scarlet rot, during her battle with General Radahn, in the Caelid Wilds. [348031020] I should like to meet her, this vanished woman. [348031030] I think she's in the north. [348031040] In the lands that lie beyond the Erdtree. Section 32 [348032000] Are you... [348032010] Giving me this arm? [348032020] I thank you. [348032030] I am in your debt, yet again. [348032040] I think, If the arm serves well enough, [348032050] It might be possible for me to wield a sword again. Section 33 [348033000] If the arm serves well enough, [348033010] It might be possible for me to wield a sword again. [348033020] Perhaps, then, I can aid you in battle. Section 35 [348035000] Now, I'm tracing the path Malenia took. [348035010] She's passed into to the lands that lie beyond the Erdtree. Section 40 [348040000] Ah, we meet yet again. [348040010] The arm you gave me truly is a thing of wonder. [348040020] It feels just like my own, even handling a sword. [348040030] Perhaps it is foolish to say this to you of all people, but I am sure of my skill with the sword. [349021040] Millicent rests at the church atop the cliff, beyond Sellia, the town yonder. [349021050] Tended to by the witless pests who worship her, or rather, her rotting sickness, as a god. Section 01 [800001000] You're a Tarnished, I can see it. [800001010] And I can also see... [800001020] That you're not after my throat. [800001030] Then why not purchase a little something? [800001040] I am Kalé. Purveyor of fine goods. Section 02 [800002000] What is it? Still going to purchase something? Section 03 [800003000] Wait, weren't you...? [800003010] Well, you're back. Care to buy something? Section 04 [800004000] Ah, it's you again. [800004010] Always a pleasure. Care to purchase anything? Section 05 [800005000] Good-bye for now. Section 06 [800006000] Good-bye. Nice to do business. Section 07 [800007000] I am of a nomadic people. [800007010] Selling wares as I travel. [800007020] The land has been tainted by madness since the shattering of the Elden Ring. [800007030] It's only Tarnished like yourself who keep things from drying up entirely. [800007040] Let's say you're a very welcome customer. Section 08 [800008000] You know, if you can spare the runes, [800008010] you should buy yourself a crafting kit. [800008020] A crafting kit allows you to make basic items on your own. [800008030] Essential really, if you intend to survive out here for any duration. [800008040] The kit costs a bundle, and I admit, I do take my cut. [800008050] But the important thing is that you survive. Every customer counts, after all. Section 09 [800009000] I'm glad you took my warning to heart. [800009010] You've made an excellent choice. Section 10 [800010000] There are others of my people who yet survive in these lands. [800010010] If the mood takes you when you meet one, then offer them some trade, won't you? [800010020] My people, wanderers all, have long been spurned by the grace of gold. [800010030] Which is why we cannot settle, but instead are forced into this pitiful, unceasing journey. [800010040] But thanks to that, things are not so different for us now, though the Elden Ring is shattered. [800010050] I think this makes us kindred spirits of sorts. [800010060] Your people, the Tarnished, and mine. Section 11 [800011000] I suppose I shouldn't keep this from you. [800011010] I'm thinking of moving elsewhere for a time. [800011020] My people are wanderers all, which I won't deny is one reason... [800011030] But I've done all I can here, in search of the Great Caravan. Section 12 [800012000] Perhaps you don't need to hear this, but... [800012010] See that no harm comes to my kin. [800012020] We have a saying, we wanderers. [800012030] Lament not your solitude. Expect no sympathy. No regard. Nothing. [800012040] But if anyone dares harm us, show them no mercy. [800012050] That is our code, so to speak. [800012060] Just the way we are. Deeply... unforgiving. Section 13 [800013000] Ah, by the way... [800013010] Have you heard of the Great Caravan? Section 14 [800014000] ...I see, more's the pity. [800014010] Well, even we had a place to call home, once. [800014020] The Great Caravan, they called it… but it's been lost to us for ages. [800014030] I've been searching for it as long as I can remember. [800014040] And with a name like that, [800014050] You'd hope they kept some fine goods there, eh. Section 15 [800015000] The howl of a wolf, in the Mistwood... [800015010] I suppose he must still be skulking about... [800015020] Mmm, I know. Why not meet him for yourself? [800015030] Next time you hear the wolf's howl, make this signal right under the source. [800015040] Oh, don't fret, there is nothing to fear. [800015050] I just have an inkling the two of you might hit it off. Section 16 [800016000] Oh, by the way. There's someone you should meet. [800016010] If you happen to hear a wolf's howl, make this signal under the source. Section 17 [800017000] Oh, then you met Blaidd, did you? [800017010] Wonderful. I'm glad I pointed you in his direction. [800017020] He's boorish, blunt, and couldn't find his nose with both hands, but he's a good egg. [800017030] I think the two of you are sure to find the best in one another. Section 30 [800030000] Ah, good to see you. [800030010] I knew leaving the sign would be worth the trouble. [800030020] Thought I'd set up shop here for a time. [800030030] A pleasure, as ever. Care to purchase anything? Section 31 [800031000] We meet again, I see. [800031010] It's me, Kalé. [800032010] You know, a burial crow, with a letter fastened to its claw? [800032020] Well, if you do set eyes upon it, I'll buy that letter from you, no question. [800032030] I'd give you a generous sum for it, of course. Section 33 [800033000] My thanks. I've been wanting to get my hands on this. [800033010] And I was willing to pay whatever was needed. Your reward, as promised. Section 34 [800034000] So, about the letter you brought me... [800034010] It's just as I suspected, it features a cryptogram of my people. [800034020] And I'm sure it's come from wherever the Great Caravan disappeared to. [800034030] This could be my chance to get close to it. [800034040] Thanks to you. Section 35 [800035000] Once I decipher that cryptogram, I'll be packing up shop again. [800035010] Don't worry, I'll leave a sign that shows where I've gone. [800035020] With any luck, I'll see you there, eh. Section 36 [800036000] I've always preferred my own company, to that of other people's... [800036010] And I don't have any burning questions I wish to ask my ancestors... [800036020] But there's something I need to know. [800036030] My roots. [800036040] I want to know who I am. Where I came from. Where I'm headed. Section 50 [800050000] Ah, good to see you. [800050010] I knew leaving the sign would be worth the trouble. [800050020] The shop is all set up. [800050030] A pleasure as ever. Care to purchase anything? Section 51 [800051000] Oh yes, about the cryptogram from the letter... [800051010] I think it's pointing underneath the capital. [800051020] I think it's pointing here, underneath the capital. [800051030] But I'm perplexed as to the path to take down there. [800051040] Well, the journey can wait, I suppose. [800051050] I'll settle here for the time being, and start looking into it. Section 52 [800052000] Where...did you find this letter? Section 53 [800053000] I can't imagine how it ended up there... [800053010] But the well might just lead under the capital. [800053020] To the spot indicated by the cryptogram from the letter. [800053030] Seems like an odd place for the Great Caravan... [800053040] But no amount of thinking will change anything. I'll be heading straight there, after some preparation. [800053050] Once again, I find myself in your debt. [800053060] Take this, as a token of my appreciation. [800053070] It's not from my usual stock, but something rather more special. [800053080] I hope you can join me at the Great Caravan, in fact. [800053090] Who knows what wonders there might be to trade? Section 54 [800054000] Ah, you, is it... [800054010] Did you see? What they did to my ancestors? [800054020] The whole clan, buried alive. Sick. Maddened. Husks of themselves. [800054030] Have you heard their moans? They're hardly human anymore. [800054040] They think we worship the Three Fingers? That we called the maddening sickness down upon them? [800054050] Well. If that's what they expect from us, then that's what they shall get from us!  [800054060] The world of grace and its people should have been content to see us sink between the cracks. [800054070] But to have intruded upon our solace... Having broken us upon their whims... [800054080] I'll never forgive any of you. Section 55 [800055000] I'm sorry, but we won't be trading any longer. [800055010] And...I think it's time we parted ways. [800055020] Guided by grace, you seek to become Elden Lord. [800055030] I don't want anything to do with you Tarnished lot any more. Section 56 [800056000] I should apologise to you. Resting at a site of grace will restore your HP, FP, and cleanse any status ailments. It will also refill your sacred flasks. However, most of the enemies you've defeated will be revived. You can find sites of grace by going where light converges. *These explanations are acquired in the form of info items and can be accessed from the inventory at any time.

Use your map to check your current position, as well as the terrain and surrounding structures. You can update your map with new information by finding map fragments at steles along the road. You can also use the map to freely place beacons of light to serve as landmarks as you explore. :

You will need cracked pots or other containers to craft certain items. You will not be able to make more of those items than you have containers. Container items will run out with use, but the containers themselves will remain.
You can use the Birdseye Telescopes found in various areas to get a bird's-eye view of the terrain in the direction that the telescope is facing. : Zoom in : Zoom out

The Roundtable Hold is a place where Tarnished gather, guided by grace. Combat is prohibited on the premises due to a pact of non-aggression. (This rule is in effect when the Roundtable icon is displayed.) The Roundtable Hold is located outside of this world. It can only be reached through sites of grace. (Can also be accessed by using the map to travel.) :

Monk Jiko seeks the deep fog of sleep. Find someone in a deep sleep, and capture their Dream Mist by using St. Trina's Crystal Ball. Those in a deep sleep can be identified by the mist surrounding them. when near someone in a deep sleep: Capture Dream Mist

The Great Runes you receive by defeating shardbearers have lost their beneficial power. However, their power can be restored at Divine Towers throughout the Lands Between. See the description of each Great Rune to discover which Divine Tower you should visit.

With the Equipment menu, you can equip armaments, arrows, bolts, armor, talismans, and items. You can equip up to three armaments each to your left and right hands. The actions each armament performs will vary based on which hand is wielding it.
With the Item Crafting menu, you can make various items from materials that you find. You can learn to craft more items by finding cookbooks.

With the Inventory menu, you can browse the items you're carrying, drop them on the ground, or throw them away. You can also use tools from the Inventory menu. : Show large image and explanation. : Toggle character data

With the Status menu, you can check your level, attributes, base stats, and more. The information shown here also reflects changes to your attack, defense, and resistances bestowed by armaments and armor that you have equipped.

With the Messages menu, you can write messages that players in other worlds can read at the spot where you left them. You can change the message format to leave more complex messages and also attach gestures to your messages. You can rate other players' messages. Whenever another player rates a message that you've written, your HP will be replenished.

With the Multiplayer menu, you can use various multiplayer items. If you set a group password, you'll be more likely to see messages, summon signs, bloodstains, phantoms, and so on from others using the same password. If you set a multiplayer password, you'll only be matched with other players using the same password for most multiplayer features. However, multiplayer passwords do not apply to invasion multiplayer.

With the Map menu, you can check your current position and terrain and buildings in the surrounding area. You can also freely place beacons of light to serve as landmarks as you explore. Lastly, through your map, you can select any site of grace that you've discovered and travel there instantaneously. However, there are some dungeons and other areas where this cannot be done.

With the Level Up menu, you can spend runes to increase your attributes. With each attribute increase, your level rises by one. As your level rises, so does the amount of runes required for your next attribute increase.
You can increase the number of flasks available. Locate Flask Shards in order to increase the number of flasks.
You can increase the healing amount of each flask. Locate "Immortal Ashes" in order to increase the healing amount.

With this menu, you can allocate the number of uses in each of your flasks. You have a set total of maximum flask uses. You can decide how many of those uses are for the HP-replenishing Flask of Crimson Tears, and how many are for the FP-replenishing Flask of Cerulean Tears.

With the Memorize Spells menu, you can memorize sorceries and incantations. You must have a staff equipped to cast sorceries, or a sacred seal equipped to cast incantations. Casting sorceries and incantations consumes FP. Your memory slots determine the number of sorceries and incantations you can memorize. You can increase your memory slots by obtaining a Memory Stone.

With this menu, you can place items that you're carrying into the chest for storage, or take stored items out of the chest. If you are already carrying the maximum number of items when you pick up a new item, it will be stored in the chest automatically.
With the shop menu, you can spend runes to purchase various items. You can also sell items for runes. Each merchant stocks a different variety of items for purchase.
Weapons and shields can be upgraded by using upgrade materials. Higher ranked upgrade materials are required for highler level weapons.

With the Ashes of War menu, you can use Ashes of War to grant skills and affinities to your armaments at sites of grace. An armament can only have one skill. Any skill it previously had will be lost. By adding an affinity, you can alter an armament's attack affinity, boost attribute scaling, and more. An armament's type determines what skills and affinities it can have. Some special armaments cannot be granted new skills or affinities using Ashes of War.
With the Spirit Tuning menu, you can spend runes and Grave Gloveworts to strengthen the spirits you summon from ashes. To strengthen named spirits, you'll need Ghost Gloveworts.
You can learn magic from the Dragon Communion. Memorize these spells by offering Dragon Communion Seeds.
With the Great Rune menu, you can equip Great Runes that have had their power restored. You can use a Rune Arc to give even greater benefits to your equipped Great Runes.
With this menu, you can mix two crystal tears in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. This will allow you to create physicks with various custom effects.

With the Rebirth menu, you can spend Larval Tears to clear your levels and reassign them from square one. You must reassign all levels until you reach your present level and you cannot make any attributes lower than their initial level determined by your origin.
With the Power of Remembrance menu, you can draw out the power of a remembrance's namesake. Each remembrance can provide one power. Once that power is claimed, the remembrance will be lost.

With the smithing menu, you can spend runes and smithing stones to strengthen your armaments. You can strengthen your armaments up to +3 at a smithing table. Somewhere in the Lands Between, you may meet a blacksmith who can make your armaments even stronger.

With the Remembrance Duplication menu, you can duplicate remembrances you've previously acquired. (This includes remembrances from which you've already drawn out power.) Duplication can only be performed once per mausoleum.
No armament equipped. Bare fists will be used to attack.
A standard dagger with a straight blade. Though modest in reach and capacity for harm, this weapon is light enough to jab in rapid succession and delivers devastating critical hits.

Dagger once belonging to one of the assassins who murdered Godwyn the Golden on the Night of the Black Knives. A ritual performed on the oddly misshapen blade imbued it with the power of the stolen Rune of Death.
A knife with curved handguards. Designed to parry, turning foes' attacks against them. For masters of combat who anticipate every enemy strike and counter accordingly, this weapon is all they need.

Dagger favored by military physicians in white. The pointed blade is hard and sharp, making critical hits especially potent. Medicine is mercy, and mercy upon the battlefield is ruthless. Beware the killers clothed as men of compassion.

Jagged dagger with a distinctive curved blade. Used by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood. This dagger rips the flesh as it enters, inflicting blood loss with sickening efficacy. A proud testament to the success of its vicious design, this weapon is perpetually coated in blood.
A knife made by sharpening hard crystal. Signature weapon of glintstone miners. Used as tool to extract glintstone from broken rock, and as such a faint magic enwreathes the blade.

Sickle decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard. Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.

Ritual blade once presented to Leyndell by the Academy of Raya Lucaria to celebrate their newfound peace. Though the weapon is embedded with precious glintstones and features Erdtree ornamentation, the undulating blade is symbolic of an ancient ritual.
Dagger fashioned from a great scorpion's tail, glistening with scarlet rot. A ceremonial tool used by heretics, crafted from the relic of a sealed outer god.
Large knife with a broad, curved blade. This weapon is designed to slash and rend, inflicting blood loss upon the recipient.

Short sword with a tempering pattern on the blade. A weapon unique to warriors of the Land of Reeds. Afflicts targets with blood loss. These swords are considered auxiliary weapons. Yet, one man is known to wield this weapon in his left hand while using a full-sized katana in his right. A demonic swordsman known only as Okina.

Short sword given to high ranking clergymen of Farum Azula. Raises potency of bestial incantations. The design celebrates a beast's five fingers, symbolic of the intelligence once granted upon their kind.
Sickle fashioned from ivory. Weapon carried by aged Albinaurics. These weapons are evidence of their dedication to the Haligtree, despite never having entered its presence.
Dagger with a bloodstained blade. Afflicts targets with blood loss. As blood darkened the dagger through repeated slashing and stabbing, its blade only grew sharper and harder.

An erdsteel dagger with a grass crest engraved upon its blade. Carried by the Erdtree royalty for self-defense in times of peace. Though forged to a high standard, the weapon is difficult to wield. Attack power also scales with faith.

Dagger given to one who set out on a journey to fulfill her duty long ago. The power of its former owner, the kindling maiden, is still apparent. The one who walks alongside flame, Shall one day meet the road of Destined Death.
A straight sword with a double-edged blade. In addition to its reliable standard damage, this weapon also boasts powerful piercing attacks. A superbly balanced armament.

A short straight sword with a short blade. In addition to its reliable standard damage, this weapon also boasts powerful piercing attacks. Lightweight amongst straight swords, this weapon is easy to wield, requiring only humble attributes.
A straight sword with a wide blade, suited to slashing attacks. Horizontal swings boast wide attack range, making it easier to connect with foes.
A straight sword with a wide blade. Effective for slashing attacks. Broad horizontal swings widen the attack range, making it easier to connect with foes.

Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army. Though blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a serviceable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.

Straight sword with a rather short but wide blade. Simple to wield, it was known as the sword of the people. Though the Erdtree styling is still visible, time has not been kind to this sword, now merely a shadow of its former self.

Slender straight sword patterned after an antique ornament. Superior swordsmen prefer to wield one in each hand. After falling from grace, the dregs of the golden lineage sought power and purpose in the past.
A sword made to commemorate the death of Godwyn the Golden, first of the demigods to die. Infused with the humble prayer of a young boy; "O brother, lord brother, please die a true death."
A grim weapon wielded by swordsmen of the Eternal City, this shotel has a blade as fine as a needle. Forged from the liquid metal of a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened.

Sword forged by compounding silver and gold. A sacred weapon to hunt Those Who Live in Death. Deals holy damage. The inseparable twins found solace in the Golden Order, the only institution not to revile them as accursed beings.
Sharp sword used by D, Knight of the Golden Order. The blade was forged with a mix of silver and brass.

Hidden sword once granted to the Tarnished of the Roundtable by the Two Fingers. A formless cipher comprises its blade, which deals holy damage no shield can repel. Champions would gather at the Roundtable Hold in days long past, when the Two Fingers were masters of oration, their flesh yet full of vigor.

Storied sword and treasure of Caria Manor. One of the legendary armaments. Astrologers, who preceded the sorcerers, established themselves in mountaintops that nearly touched the sky, and considered the Fire Giants their neighbors.

Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.

Straight sword embedded with a blue glintstone. Weapon of knights sworn to Carian royalty. These knights' swords could serve as catalysts, letting them wield sorcerous battle skills. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, this power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle.

Silver sword carried by clerics of St. Trina. Inflicts sleep ailment upon foes. St. Trina is an enigmatic figure. Some say she is a comely young girl, others are sure he is a boy. The only certainty is that their appearance was as sudden as their disappearance.

Sword forged by servants of Miquella of the Haligtree, with a design modeled after those carried by Carian knights. Instead of glintstone however, amber from the Haligtree is embedded in the blade. A sumptuous piece, yet it has never been offered to any knight—an ill-starred sword with no master.

Beloved sword of an aged knight whose last quest was long behind him, repurposed into a walking stick. The tip is rather worn. Though bent of back and without the brawn required even to raise the sword aloft, still he wished to meet his end with weapon in hand.

Treasured sword of Eochaid, a lesser, long-vanished domain. The copper coloration is not to be confused for rust, but is a conduit for its wielder to move it by their will alone. Swords of Eochaid dance through the skies.
Narrow blade carried by wandering nobles. Made to be easy to wield. Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.
Talon-swords are affixed to the legs of Stormveil's warhawks, but this one has been repurposed for human use. The blade is thin and lightweight so as not to obstruct the hawk's mobility.

A sword with a glintstone in its handguards. Wielded by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus who seek to master Carian sorcery. Deals magic damage. Apparently once used as a staff of sorcery, this sword is made of wood.
Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.

A large sword with a straight blade. This heavy sword is usually wielded with two hands, but for those with enough strength, one is sufficient. The hefty blade can be swung into multiple foes at once thanks to the broad, sweeping attack, making fending off crowds all the easier.
Oddly shaped greatsword wielded by imps. The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.
Greatsword with a blade of unusually thick steel. A coarse weapon to which polishing is a foreign concept. Weighty even among others of its class, the impact of each strike is sure to be felt.

Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army. Though blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a serviceable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.

Greatsword bestowed upon skilled swordsmen in the demigods' service, and yet had no rank or title. Featuring a long grip enabling dual-handed use, this weapon was designed to dispatch larger foes. Being charged with such a duty was undoubtedly a great honor.

Greatsword featuring a flame-like undulation. Shreds enemy flesh, inducing blood loss. Scarlet rot is kept at bay with flame at Redmane Castle, and as such, this beloved sword of Jerren's eventually became the symbol of the castle itself.

Greatsword of Ordovis, one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights. This sword is imbued with an ancient holy essence. Its red tint exemplifies the nature of primordial gold, said to be close in nature to life itself.

Greatsword forged from a blue-white meteoric ore. The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic. A weapon unique to the Alabaster Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.

A finely-crafted greatsword intricately engraved with an ancient motif. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

A Moon Greatsword, bestowed by a Carian queen upon her spouse to honor long-standing tradition. One of the legendary armaments. Ranni's sigil is a full moon, cold and leaden, and this sword is but a beam of its light.

Sword wrought from the remains of a god who should have lived a life eternal. Thoughts on what the weapon portends are many and varied. Some consider it the mark of a great sin, or a sign of great devastation. Some think it as the end of an age, while others; the beginning.

Greatsword patterned after the black steeple of the Helphen, the lampwood which guides the dead of the spirit world. The lamplight is similar to grace in appearance, only it is said that it can only be seen by those who met their death in battle.

Sacred sword of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy. Remains of the countless heroes he has devoured writhe upon the surface of this blade. Now they share the same blood, bound together as family. Some HP is restored upon defeating an enemy.

Storied sword of House Marais, the family of executioners who presided over the Shaded Castle. One of the legendary armaments. Elemer of the Briar, the Bell Bearing Hunter, snatched the sword from the site of his looming execution, and furnished it with battle skills from his home of Eochaid.
